published_attributes.title: Introduction
published_attributes.serialized_body:
I this short course you'll get to know about useful Bridge functions that help leaders and managers take care of their team.

What you'll learn about:

  1. Team Dashboard: One-on-one meetings (1on1 Agendas), Team meetings (Team Agendas), Feedback, Individual Goals
  2. Team Goals
  3. Skills
  4. Face-to-face (Performance Conversation)
  5. Insights
  6. Checkpoints

Team Goals
Skills
Face-to-face (Performance Conversation)
Insights
Checkpoints

published_attributes.title: Team dashboard
published_attributes.serialized_body:
You'll find all your team data under the TEAM tab. In this view you see all 1on1 Agendas, Group Agendas, Individual and Team Goals and Skills.

You can also enter each team member profile and see their detailed profile with Development Plan, Career Vision, Individual Goals, Feedback and their Learning progress.

A wonderful improvement to your work is also the view of their whole history in one dashboard.

published_attributes.title: Team Goals
published_attributes.serialized_body:
The previous view allowed you to address each employee separately. Team goals panel allows you to keep track of team goals.

Only you can add goals to the Team Goals section.

published_attributes.title: Skills
published_attributes.serialized_body: As a manager or leader you can view the skills feedback (more on skill feedback coming soon) and skill coverage within your team.

blocks.text: As a manager or leader you can view the skills feedback (more on skill feedback coming soon) and skill coverage within your team.

published_attributes.title: Face-to-face (Performance Conversation)
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Manager Access to Performance Conversations (PC)

You can access Performance Conversations from the main Bridge Screen called "Me". Performance Conversations relevant to an open PC cycle will be found under the "Growth" section of the main screen.

Clicking on the Performance Conversation tile under Growth on the main screen will give the manager a view of their team. The manager can access their self review for their own Performance Conversation with their manager, or click on the Start link next to one of their employees and begin the Performance Conversation process for that employee.

The manager will complete all sections of "Wins", "Plan", and "Other" to prepare the Performance Conversation Agenda. This includes, Goals, Feedback, Achievements and Learning.

When the manager has completed all sections of the Performance Conversation, they'll choose "Submit" and an agenda will be created.

Back at the Performance Conversation details page you can see the current status of the PC Cycle for all of your team.

published_attributes.title: Insights
published_attributes.serialized_body: At your disposal you have an Insights panel that shows extensive analytics of learning, 1on1 Cadence, Skill Mastery, Goal Performance and Performance Conversations.

blocks.text: At your disposal you have an Insights panel that shows extensive analytics of learning, 1on1 Cadence, Skill Mastery, Goal Performance and Performance Conversations.

published_attributes.title: Checkpoints for managers
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Checkpoints are learning content items that include a title and a set of instructions for users to follow. Users see assigned checkpoints on their My Learning page. When users finish a checkpoint, they can mark the checkpoint as complete. You can add a checkpoint to assign action items to users in your account.

Creating checkpoints:

You can require users to upload evidence that they completed the checkpoint [3]. To enable checkpoint evidence, click the Requires Evidence toggle button. This setting requires users to upload evidence files before the checkpoint can be completed. Enabling or disabling this setting will only affect users who have not yet had their checkpoint approved.

You can also choose to require approval of users checkpoint completions by another Bridge user [4]. To enable checkpoint approvals, click the Requires Approval toggle button. You can choose between requiring each user's manager, a specific user, or member of a group approve the checkpoint completions. When a user submits the checkpoint for approval, the designated approver will see the pending approval on the My Approvals page. To require checkpoint approval for users to move forward in a program, click the Blocks In-Order Programs toggle button.

The Due Date setting can be enabled by clicking the Due Date toggle button [5]. When the Due Date setting is enabled, you can set the requirement for users to complete the checkpoint within a certain number of days or on a specific date [6].

To send a certificate to users upon completion of the checkpoint, click the Certificate toggle button [7].

Note: If the Requires Approval setting is disabled, only the user can view and download the evidence they uploaded to the checkpoint. 

Viewing checkpoints for approval:

You can find all the checkpoints assigned to you for your approval in your learning section.
